TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DiscoveryClientBindingElement extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement

Docs.summary: A binding element that can be added to a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client application to take advantage of the Discovery client channel. The Discovery client channel allows a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client application to access a discoverable service without knowing the endpoint address in advance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Discovery client channel is used by creating a custom binding element and adding a DiscoveryClientBindingElement to the top of the binding stack. [!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/crabout-md.md)] the Discovery client channel, see [Using the Discovery Client Channel](../Topic/Using%20the%20Discovery%20Client%20Channel.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public DiscoveryClientBindingElement ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.UdpDiscoveryEndpoint> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryClientBindingElement.FindCriteria%2A> is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public DiscoveryClientBindingElement (System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpointProvider discoveryEndpointProvider, System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCriteria findCriteria);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpointProvider discoveryEndpointProvider, class System.ServiceModel.Discovery.FindCriteria findCriteria) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that gets a discovery endpoint.
An object that contains the information required to search for a service provider.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified endpoint provider and service finding criteria.
